{"blocks":[{"key":"cvqaj","text":"·      Weigh tissue samples by transferring into pre-weighed 1.5ml Eppendorf tube 
·      Subtract empty tube weight from weight of tube containing sample to get sample weight
·      Add 180µl of homogenization buffer per mg of tissue (1mg:180µl, weight:volume)
·      Add 2 Tungsten beads (Qiagen cat# 69997) / tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5m8t7","text":"·       Move tubes to pre-chilled Tissue Lyser (Qiagen cat # 85300) rack and run at 30 cycles/sec for 1 min
·       Put rack back on ice and set a timer for 5 min
·       Repeat homogenization in Tissue Lyser for 1min
·       Quick spin in pre-cooled microcentrifuge to remove liquid from cap of tubes
·       Place samples in -80 oC freezer until frozen
·       Once frozen, thaw samples in room temperature water bath. Move racks around slowly in water bath to ensure circulation of water 
·       Repeat freeze-thaw cycle 2X. Final thaw of samples is performed on the day assays are run
·       Vortex samples for 2 seconds to ensure homogeneity, transfer samples to 96-well block","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":331,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9nifn","text":"Assay Principle:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"csruo","text":"Citrate synthase (CS) enzymatic activity is determined by the change in absorbance of DTNB (Ellman’s reagent) measured at 412 nm. Thiol groups (R-SH) reach with DTNB, cleaving the disulfide bond to generate 2 NTB- molecules, which ionizes to an NTB2- dianion in water at neutral and alkaline pH. This NTB2- ion has a yellow color and absorbs light at 412 nm. The reaction requires oxaloacetate to\nproceed and generate thiol groups. The enzymatic activity of CS is determined by quantifying the rate of conversion of DTNB into the yellow NTB2-. The molar extinction coefficient of DTNB is 13.6 L x mol-1 x cm-1.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":212,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":248,"length":3},{"style":"sup","offset":304,"length":2},{"style":"sup","offset":540,"length":2},{"style":"sup","offset":600,"length":2},{"style":"sup","offset":607,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bfcmv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"27rka","text":" {"blocks":[{"key":"b2moi","text":"Spectrophotometer settings:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":27},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":27}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"75cqf","text":"  Assays are recorded on a Spectramax M2 (Spectramax Pro 6, Molecular Devices)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"92ieq","text":"  The assay is run at 30 oC","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":25,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dbpuu","text":"  Read absorbance at 412 nm","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9g7l5","text":"  Set spectrophotometer to read only half of the plate at a time (to maximize reading time)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c4itn","text":"Running the assay:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1j67","text":"·       In a 96-well plate, pipet 10 ml of Oxaloacetate ([final] = 100mM).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":34,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4t7","text":"·       Pipette 10ml of sample homogenate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":16,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fdrv","text":"·       Add 200ml of CS assay mix to each well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":12,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5bgdj","text":"·       Quickly put plate in spectrophotometer and read.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b0lu","text":"·       Record slopes for each sample","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"mfdo","text":"·       The negative control is the assay mix + samples without oxaloacetate; the slope should be ~0.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7bp94","text":"·       Obtain a measure of each sample in duplicates","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"28u0s","text":"The enzymatic activity is determined with the molar extinction coefficient of DTNB = 13.6 mM-1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":92,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3rmm0","text":"Principle of assay:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2u6tv","text":"Succinate dehydrogenase (SDH, also succinate-ubiquinone reductase or Complex II of the electron transport system – EC 1.3.99.1) activity is determined by the change in absorbance of DCIP measured at 600nm. Oxidation of succinate and decylubiquinone by complex II reduces DCIP, which decreases its absorbance at 600nm. Rotenone and KCN are used to inhibit electron flow through complexes I and IV, respectively. Addition of malonate (an inhibitor of SDH) at the end of the assay allows to measure DCIP reduction independently from SDH. SDH enzymatic activity is then computed from the difference between the two slopes. The molar extinction coefficient of DCIP is 16.3 L x mol-1 x cm-1.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":675,"length":2},{"style":"sup","offset":682,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f40n9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2upmh","text":"Buffers steps.section: COMPLEX I (NADH-UBIQUINONE OXIDOREDUCTASE, EC 1.6.99.3) ENZYMATIC ACTIVITY ASSAY
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8fsrs","text":"Principle of assay :","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4vdi2","text":"The activity of Complex I of the electron transport system (also NADH-Ubiquinone Oxidoreductase EC 1.3.99.3) is determined by the change in absorbance of DCIP, which accept electrons from CI. Oxidation of NADH and decylubiquinone by the enzyme leads to a decrease in the absorbance of DCIP as it is reduced. Antimycin A and KCN are used to inhibit electron flow through complexes III and IV, respectively. Addition of Rotenone and Piericidin A (inhibitors of Complex I) allows measurement of non-specific NADH oxidation. Specific Complex I enzymatic activity is then computed from the difference between the two slopes. The molar extinction coefficient of DCIP is 16.3 L x mol-1 x cm-1.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":676,"length":2},{"style":"sup","offset":683,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dqsi","text":"The molar extinction coefficient of NADH is 6.22 L x mol-1 x cm-1.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":56,"length":2},{"style":"sup","offset":63,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2rhhj","text":"This assay was modified based on the method of Janssen et al. Clin Chemistr 2007; 53(4):729-734. steps.section: COMPLEX IV (COX – CYTOCHROME C OXIDASE) ENZYMATIC ACTIVITY ASSAY
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4q2kp","text":"Assay Principle:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bqjov","text":"Cytochrome c oxidase (COX, Complex IV of the electron transport system) enzymatic activity is determined by the decrease in absorbance of cytochrome c (cyt c) induced through its oxidation by COX. For the assay to work, it is essential to provide purified reduced cyt c. This is accomplished by preparing cyt c with dithionite, and then by purifying it from dithionite with filter tubes. Enzymatic activity is obtained by quantifying the rate of conversion from reduced to oxidized cyt c. The molar extinction coefficient of reduced cyt c is 29.5 L x mol-1 x cm-1. For example, if you are running 50 different samples measured in triplicates, you will need about 360ml of cyt c: [1.2ml x (50 samples x 6 measures) = 360ml]. Make sure there is enough in the freezer before you start.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2d8up","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cnkpq","text":"NOTE: the final usable volume for the assay will be about 20-25% of that prepared from the beginning. steps.section: PREPARING REDUCED CYTOCHROME C FOR COX ASSAY
steps.step:
{"blocks":[{"key":"eptnu","text":"Dilution and reduction
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cruq8","text":"To prepare 20ml (initial) of cyt c, take 100ml of KPi buffer (50mM) and adjust pH at 7.0","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8avjn","text":"
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8lhqp","text":"The extra 80 ml are for the washing steps later in the protocol","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fo7rk","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ed0c0","text":"Add 20ml of KPi buffer 50mM to a 5 g bottle of cytochrome c (Sigma C7752-5g) (250mg/ml)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bqjbp","text":"
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1705l","text":"Transfer to a 50ml Falcon tube and put on ice in the dark","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a8sqs","text":"·       Add 150 (300mg was added) mg of sodium bisulfite (dithionite) (7.5 mg/ml) (Sigma 157953, MW: 174.11)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ffipe","text":"·       Incubate for 5 minutes on ice and protect from light","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5skrb","text":"·       Keep at 4oC from that point on","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":17,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dkg6a","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7dltj","text":"Purification ","type":"header-three","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f0oms","text":"·       Put 500 ml of the mix (KPi buffer + cyt c + dithionite) in 1.5 ml size ultracentrifugation filter tubes 10K MWCO (Amicon Ultra-0.5 mL 10kD Centrifugal Filters – Millipore UFV2BGC10[[1]]) [Note: 3kD will also work]","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":188,"length":5},{"style":"italic","offset":196,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":189,"length":3}],"data":{}},{"key":"gq1d","text":"o   Vivaspin 2, # VS0291 (3000MWKO)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"jkrc","text":"·       Centrifuge for 10 minutes at 10 000g for 1.5mltubes. The goal is to drain about 75% of the added volume. The sodium dithionite leaves through the filter with the buffer but cyt c is too big to go
through and remains in the tube. [Note: 3kD columns will need to be spun down faster and for much longer]","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":238,"length":70}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5bg48","text":"·       Re-fill the filter tube with ice cold buffer (KPi 50mM) to re-suspend and rinse the cyt c.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8tvf2","text":"·       Repeat centrifugation and rinse steps for a total of 4 washes and about 40 minutes of centrifugation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"avmfk","text":"·       After the last centrifugation, invert filters in new tube bottoms provided in the kit. Spin these tubes at 1000g for one minute to retrieve the concentrated, purified cyt c. For a starting volume in each tube of 600ml, you should extract 100-200ml at the end.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aoegl","text":"·       Pool all collected product in one tube so that you have an homogenous mix. Quickly vortex. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"57v7k","text":"·       Estimate the volume and leave on ice and protected from light.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ptfs","text":" ","type":"header-three","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1d7hf","text":"Measuring the concentration
and purity of reduced cytochrome c","type":"header-three","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":62}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6cmak","text":"·       Prepare two tubes for quantification","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"su64","text":"o   1ml of purified cyt c to 0.5 ml of KPi buffer (1:500)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ntde","text":"o    2ml of purified cyt c to 0.5 ml of KPi buffer (1:250)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":5,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fmtvn","text":"o   4ml of purified cyt c to 0.5 ml of KPi buffer (1:125)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3pvat","text":"·      Use the spectrophotometer in Absorbance/Spectrum mode to quantify optical density","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":36,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3hr0v","text":"
 ·       
Set “Blank” wells in plate layout (to correct
for background) with only KPi buffer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"jda3","text":"·

(oxidized cyt c). Oxidized cytochrome c will not contribute to the reaction rate. The ratio OD550/OD565 should be > 6-10.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":8,"length":10},{"style":"bold","offset":75,"length":3},{"style":"bold","offset":99,"length":3},{"style":"sub","offset":75,"length":3},{"style":"sub","offset":99,"length":3},{"style":"sub","offset":197,"length":3},{"style":"sub","offset":203,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5lbd6","text":"·       The concentration of reduced cytochrome c is determined by OD550 x 500[[1]] / (29.5[3] L x mol-1 x cm-1[4]).
